Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Androctonin (natural AMPs; UCSS1a; scorpions, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods,  invertebrates, animals; 2S=S)

Literature Information.Literature: AActivity: active against the Gram-positive bacteria A. viridans (MIC 0.3-0.6 uM), M. luteus (MIC 0.6-1.5 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 1.5-3 uM), S. aureus (MICc15-30 uM), C. michiganensis (MIC 6-15 uM), B-cereus and B-thuringiensis (MIC>30 uM), Gram-negative bacteria phytopathogenic P. syringae (MIC 1.5-3.0 uM), P. syringae phaseoli, and X. vesicatoria 687.3 (MIC <3 uM), E. coli D31 (MIC 3-6 uM), E-coli D22 (MIC >30 uM), and E. coli 1106 (MIC 6-15 uM), S. enterica serovar typhimurium (MIC 3-6 uM), P. pisi (MIC 6-15 uM), P. maculicola (MIC 3-6 uM), and X. campestris pv. campestris (MIC 3-6 uM), P. valerianella (MIC 15-22 uM), E-cloacae beta-12, E-carotovora carotovora, K-pneumoniae, P-cepacia, X-campestris pv. oryzae (MIC >30 uM). Activity against fungi A. dauci (MIC 8-16 uM), A. brassicola (MIC 3-6 uM), Stemphylium (MIC 4-8 uM), F. culmorum (MIC 3-6 uM), F. oxysporum (MIC 6-12 uM), F. oxysporum M., F. oxysporum L. (MIC 2-4 uM), N. crassa, B. cinerea, N. haematococca,  T. viride (MIC 6-12 uM), B. petunia (MIC 4-8 uM), V. toreilis (MIC 2-4 uM), and A. fumigatus (MIC 25-50 uM). 2 disulphide bridges: 4;20; 10,16.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB. UPdated 4/2019; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Ehret-Sabatier L, Loew D, Goyffon M, Fehlbaum P, Hoffmann JA, van Dorsselaer A, Bulet P.1996
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of novel cysteine-rich antimicrobial peptides from scorpion blood.
